name: Cindy DeForest
review_text: Surprisingly awesome!  I was very skeptical because I like espresso beverages.  I bought this to replace a 15 year old, well loved Krups machine that had auto drip on the left and espresso on the right since I husband prefers drip.  He also loves his Keurig machine at work.  This machine was not bigger than my Krups dual purpose machine, so I didn't think the footprint was too big.  First beverage I made was an Iced Latte.  It was perfect!  It even frothed the CoffeeMate Sweet Italian Cream non-dairy creamer which my Krups machine was never able to do.  NOW, if the machine can last 15 years like my Krups I will be very happy, but that has yet to be seen.  I like it very much, it is very easy to use, and has simple instructions.
review_title: Espresso beverages are superb, and makes great drip coffee as well!

name: Reviewer
review_text: We resisted the K-Cup trend for a long time, but the features of this machine won us over.  We are stupidly happy to make this machine our first Keurig.
review_title: Makes yummy stuff from Chai.  Easy to use and it offers lots of variety.  Easy to clean.  Smart design.

name: D Foster
review_text: My first 4 cups with this brewer were frustrating... 3 cups of steamed milk (no foam) and 1 cup of cold milk (no foam). I felt like I had tried everything... skim milk, almond milk, whole milk... latte setting, cappuccino setting. I was ready to put the thing back in the box and return it because the cost was too high if all it was going to do was make a single serve coffee. My last ditch effort paid off though! I wondered, why did they give me this lid for the frother? Maybe it serves a purpose in the process. So I used 2% Promised Land milk on the cappuccino setting WITH THE LID ON THE FROTHER. Success! It wasn t just a little foam or thin either. There was a lot of foam and very thick. So, if you re having issues with foam and you haven t used the lid, try it! For some reason, it makes all the difference.
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

name: Sarah Bradshaw
review_text: I am already is love with this machine. It makes an amazing latte. I have been waiting for keurig to come out with one. We have an espresso machine but we never use it cause it was such a pain to make anything with it. Making a latte is so easy and clean up is a breeze with this new machine. Makes great regular coffee just like you expect with a keurig machine. Only thing I would change is a feature that allows you to have it turn on at a preset time. It does take a little longer to heat up compared to our older keurig model.
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

name: AndieP
review_text: OMG!  This K-Cafe is THE bomb!  I am so thrilled to be making all the fancy, expensive drinks at home now!  I researched this model for some time as I didn t want to buy a $1,000 + model from Italy and this seemed just perfect for hubby and I (I like caps and lattes and he likes a good ol cuppa Joe).  So I finally decided to try it & received my K-Cafe yesterday.  Super easy set up and directions were short, simple and clear.  Made my first cap this morning.  I used a decaf Peet s K-cup for my shot and since I only had half and half in the fridge, used that.  Omg!  It took me less than 5 minutes to make my cap (and that was while reading the directions while I made it) and the volume of foam on the milk was INCREDIBLE!  More than I ve ever had at a custom OR indie coffee shop.  Of course that had a lot to do with the fat in the half and half but darn, that frother works really well.  I can t wait to see how whole milk and almond milk turn out.  I also love how easy it is to rinse out the little frother pot, too for use the next time.  Bottom line for me and my family, this K-Cafe rocks and I ll be saving so much money and time from now on.  Thank you Keurig!  You made the perfect machine for us here!  P.s. I bought this K-cafe with my own money and no one paid me to write this review.
review_title: PHENOMENAL Coffee and Latte / Cap Maker
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

review_text: As a former Starbucks Barista and self diagnosed coffee addict this machine is a dream come true. Unlike other low budge coffee makers this machine does a great drop both heating and frothing the milk. I had given up on making lattes at home long ago after machines that were in my priced range water down the milk in a poor effort to heat and froth during the steaming process. name: Fliberty Jibbet
review_text: I did a bunch of research to find a K-Cup compatible machine that also makes lattes/cappuccinos, while offering an "espresso" option.  I know that's a lot, but that's what I wanted! :)  As far an I can see, there is nothing that compares with this machine.  True, it does not make a "legit" espresso, but the "strong" option on the machine gives me the next best thing with a dark or espresso roast.  (The "strong" option can also be used to make a stronger brew of regular coffee.)  The milk frother is wonderful.  My mother is VERY picky about her latte foam and she was amazed at how good it is. So I bought her this machine for her birthday.  It does all this AND it makes lattes/capps in Keurig time.  I researched a few other machines that offered similar options, but they brewed coffee at a glacial pace, and I don't have that kind of time to wait in the morning. Finally, it is SUPER EASY TO USE (which is also why I bought it for my mom), and I like that because I'm easily confused before my first cuppa in the morning.  Now, I will say that I've only had the machine for about two weeks, so I can't speak to it's longevity.  Fingers crossed for that. Cheers!

name: Triffy Pacitti
review_text: This machine is a great combination for those coffee / cappuccino lovers who want fast, convenient and reliable.  There is one alert, however to plug the machine into its own circuit.  The reason is that it pulls substantial amps and will trip GFI circuit breakers. From my experience, it seems to occur when the Auto Off engages.  I spoke with Keurig whose engineers agreed that it will likely trip your circuit breaker.  You can disable the Auto Off per the user guide, but I am just turning the machine off after each use.  Not as convenient, but a small sacrifice for great coffee, lattes and cappuccinos.
review_title: Great coffee, latte and cappuccino, but trips GFI circuit breakers

review_text: My wife and I love this thing -- she's not a big fan of regular coffee so the ability make espresso drinks/cappuccinos in addition to standard coffee is great and we can both use it for different types of drinks. name: Lynne Hersh
review_text: As a long time Keurig user this coffee system is a great improvement over the basic model. Most important is the coffee is hotter than any other pod coffee system I have used. Set up is very easy, the machine came with a filter system and one filter that was easy to install. The recommended replacement for the filter is 60 days. To use the basic coffee machine pressing a series of buttons is all that is needed. For regular coffee press "coffee" and then select the size by ounce and press the "k" and coffee brews. If preparing capp or Latte press the appropriate button and the "shot" lights up as the only choice. For frothing add the appropriate amount of milk by filling to the indented and marked line, put the frother on the stand, press capp or latte and the frother begins. The milk is heated while frothing or if preferred there is a cold setting. I have used almond milk and 1% for frothing and both work. For capp the following was produced...1/4 c. milk=1/2 c warm milk with 1/4 c froth.  I prepared espresso for a very hard to please coffee drinker and she was pleased. Being able to select the size cup of coffee with each pod use is a big improvement over the systems that default to the last selected coffee. No more getting a shot in the morning when expecting a nice big cup of coffee. The system also has a STRONG setting for those times a needed boost is called for. Clean up is very easy, the frother has a small disk that slides out and the vessel is easy clean.
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

name: Craig Stephans
review_text: We have been Keurig fans / users since the first k-cup machine.  With this version, Keurig has taken it to the next level that I don't see how they can improve upon.  For regular coffee, this machine gives several options for sizes and makes the same great coffee.  It has added a cappuccino and Latte option with shot sizes plus includes some sample espresso k-cups that are really good.  On the side is an excellent frother that gives options of hot or cold froth for capp or latte sizes.  The frother beeps once to indicate activation and beeps twice when ready -- heating and frothing takes 3 minutes -- about the same time from powering on to ready-to-drink coffee/ espresso.
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

name: Victoria
review_text: Love this addition to the Keurig line! Though slightly more work than the standard Keurig, frothing the milk and creating your drink is still very simple and cleanup is a snap. review_text: Overall, this Keurig works perfectly, making coffee in a variety of sizes (shots, 6oz, 8oz, 10oz, 12oz) and giving you the ability to quickly heat milk/cream while stirring that to a foamy goodness to pour into your coffee. It came with Expresso Roast Vista 44 N Green Mountain Coffee (6 cups), which our family coffee drinkers loved. Our usual cups/mugs all fit without difficulty.

name: A. Hansen
review_text: Yes, yes, yes!  I've been waiting for this for years!  A Keurig that makes lattes, and I don't mean those fake powdered lattes or the ones with "fake" milk-I mean real life lattes that taste like you went to a barrista!  This is it! First, like all Keurig's this is easy to use.  Set up is easy, open the box, soak the water filter, un-tape the pieces, rinse/clean the parts and fill with water.  Next, place the pod in the machine, put "whatever" type of milk you love in the frother and push two buttons.  The only issue is waiting.  The shot of espresso takes about 1 minute and the frother takes about 3 minutes.  Now, this is no big deal to me because it saves me money and time (going to my nearest coffee house).  I love that I can do skinny latte's or go with half and half (even soy milk etc.).  Once your espresso is done and the frother is finished, pour the milk over your espresso and you will have plenty of foam to top it off!  Rinse the frother or place on upper shelf of dishwasher.  The down side is it does take up counter space, it is not very small, but the good thing is it does hold a lot of water-you don't have to refill the reservoir too often.  It is super simple and delicious.  I feel like this is going to be the gift of the year!

review_text: The first one we had was tripping the breakers so I contacted Keurig. They quickly sent out a replacement - which is tripping the breakers. I don t feel like the frother worked as intended so don t buy it because of that. My old Keurig has never worked right so I think I m done with the brand. name: YB
review_text: I ordered this during Amazon Prime Day with the hopes of replacing my aging Keurig coffee machine (wonderful, but about 11 years old). My preference has always been lattes and cappuccinos, but I have never been satisfied with those "faux" paper packets you can get to use at home from Starbucks or even via other K cups that claim to produce a latte. This machine is the REAL deal. As a novice, I am whipping up amazing hot vanilla lattes, iced caramel lattes, etc. The instructions are super simple; the machine does all the work. I have tried skim and whole milk (or even combined the two), with great results. I don't even have to add sugar to the Green Mountain vanilla espresso or the Caribou caramel espresso that come with this product. This is going to save so much money and time. Couldn't be happier! Wish I would've found this machine a long time ago. The only downside is that so far it seems like it might be a little tricky to find the K-cups for espresso, but they are easily ordered on Amazon.  Oh, and did I mention that all the parts used daily are dishwasher safe? It's perfect!
product_name: Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee

name: usagi fun
review_text: So far we absolutely love this Keurig Coffee Maker. I was about to give up on Keurigs because we had two bad Keurigs in a row, different models than this. They were loud and brewed horrible coffee. The last model the reservoir was annoyingly difficult to fill. This model has a wonderful reservoir, large capacity and love the handle. I actually like that it shuts off automatically. I like saving electricity and I like that it's not heating up my kitchen especially during this hot summer. So it takes a couple minutes to warm up, who doesn't have patience to wait a few minutes?? Take a deep breath and meditate people if waiting three minutes is putting you over the edge. And again, relax if you're frustrated with brewing a shot of coffee and having to wait for the frother to froth. It's a fabulous function! We brew a shot of coffee, add our mix in, like syrup flavor or powdered chocolate depending while frothing the milk. The frother is great and it was so surprising the first time we used it and it made so much foam. It even froths non-dairy, like almond milk. It's so fun I couldn't believe it. I will say that it froths milk like crazy, almond milk so so but hey, it's still delicious. Also, it works great for both functions of hot or cold. Please know it takes up a lot of counter space, but remember it's not just a coffee maker it has the added frother. Overall pretty much love it.
review_title: So far we absolutely love this Keurig Coffee Maker
